pages.text: Phyllolepis is a genus of flat placoderm from the late Devonian period. They were restricted to freshwater strata and possibly lived in rivers and streams. It had eyes though lacked a sclerotic ring, which suggests reduced or blind vision, instead hunting by using sensory organs on the surface grooves of their armor plates.
